sense.name: ground or earth with grass rooted in it
sense.examples: The turf on the golf course felt springy from the recent watering. These rolls of turf will be laid out as lawns for these new houses. The turf on the racetrack is slippery today from rain. (the actual surface of the racetrack)

sense.name: the home territory of a social group
sense.examples: There is a turf battle going on between those two drug gangs in Detroit. The team will play tomorrow's game on their home turf. Each salesman has his own turf to cover in New England. The writer seems on unfamiliar turf in the themes of his latest novel. (metaphoric extension) These are people who could hurt him on his own foreign policy turf. (metaphoric extension)

sense.name: horse racing in general
sense.examples: Pete spends a lot of his money gambling on the turf. It's expensive to breed and train horses for the turf.

sense.name: dried peat used as fuel
sense.examples: The old man threw some more turf onto the fire. These little cottages are heated by burning turf in their fireplaces.
